ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - python
  - channel_sources

about.description:
Inspired by Google's zx, but made much simpler and more accessible using
 Python. While Bash is cool, and it's extremely powerful when paired with
 linux coreutils and pipes. But apart from that, it's a whole another
 language to learn, and has a (comparatively) unintuitive syntax for things
 like conditionals and loops. zxpy aims to supercharge bash by allowing you
 to write scripts in Python, but with native support for bash commands and
 pipes.

name: zxpy

about.description:
Inspired by Google's zx, but made much simpler and more accessible using
 Python. While Bash is cool, and it's extremely powerful when paired with
 linux coreutils and pipes. But apart from that, it's a whole another
 language to learn, and has a (comparatively) unintuitive syntax for things
 like conditionals and loops. zxpy aims to supercharge bash by allowing you
 to write scripts in Python, but with native support for bash commands and
 pipes.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "zxpy" %}
{% set version = "1.6.4" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/zxpy-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e510f06f791a53b3462628c99438e2f4a5038c12291002b48db2ba87cd088bbb

build:
  number: 2
  entry_points:
    - zxpy=zx:cli
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  skip: true  # [py<36]

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - pyreadline3  # [win]
    - python

test:
  imports:
    - zx
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  summary: Shell scripts made simple
  home: https://github.com/tusharsadhwani/zxpy
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  description: |
    Inspired by Google's zx, but made much simpler and more accessible using
     Python. While Bash is cool, and it's extremely powerful when paired with
     linux coreutils and pipes. But apart from that, it's a whole another
     language to learn, and has a (comparatively) unintuitive syntax for things
     like conditionals and loops. zxpy aims to supercharge bash by allowing you
     to write scripts in Python, but with native support for bash commands and
     pipes.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - thewchan
